DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates an invalid usage of React Hooks where a hook is called conditionally within a component. React Hooks must be called at the top level of a React function component or custom hook, and in the same order on every render. Violating this rule can lead to unpredictable behavior and bugs.

SOURCE: https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/main/compiler/packages/babel-plugin-react-compiler/src/__tests__/fixtures/compiler/rules-of-hooks/error.invalid-rules-of-hooks-ea7c2fb545a9.expect.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: APIDOC

```
Error: invalid-hook-call-warning

Description: Hooks must always be called in a consistent order, and may not be called conditionally. This rule ensures that React can correctly track the state of hooks across renders.

Rule Violation Example:
```javascript
function MyComponent(props) {
  if (props.show) {
    const [value, setValue] = useState(0);
  }
  // ... other code
}
```

Correct Usage:
```javascript
function MyComponent(props) {
  const [value, setValue] = useState(0);
  if (props.show) {
    // Use the state value here, but the hook is always called.
  }
  // ... other code
}
```

See also: https://react.dev/warnings/invalid-hook-call-warning
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/main/compiler/packages/babel-plugin-react-compiler/src/__tests__/fixtures/compiler/rules-of-hooks/error.invalid.invalid-rules-of-hooks-449a37146a83.expect.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Error: Invalid Hook Call

Description: Hooks must be called at the top level in the body of a function component or custom hook, and may not be called within function expressions.

Rule Violation: Hooks cannot be called inside nested functions, callbacks, or event handlers.

Example Violation:
```javascript
function MyComponent() {
  const handleClick = () => {
    useState(0); // Invalid: Called inside an event handler
  };
  return <button onClick={handleClick}>Click Me</button>;
}
```

Correct Usage:
```javascript
function MyComponent() {
  const [count, setCount] = useState(0);
  const handleClick = () => {
    setCount(count + 1);
  };
  return <button onClick={handleClick}>Clicked {count} times</button>;
}
```

See also: https://react.dev/warnings/invalid-hook-call-warning
```

TOPIC: React Hooks - Conditional Hook Call Example
Q: What specific React rule is violated by calling a Hook conditionally?
A: Calling a Hook conditionally violates the 'Rules of Hooks'. This rule mandates that Hooks must be called at the top level of a React function component or a custom Hook, not within loops, conditions, or nested functions.

TOPIC: React Hook Usage Violations
Q: What is the rule in React regarding referencing hooks as normal values?
A: In React, hooks must be called directly and cannot be referenced as normal values. This means you should not assign a hook to a variable or pass it around without invoking it.

TOPIC: React Component Hook Usage
Q: What does the error 'Hooks must be the same function on every render' indicate in React?
A: This error indicates that a hook is being called conditionally or that the function passed as a hook might be changing between renders. React requires hooks to be called at the top level of a component or custom hook, and the same hook must be called on every render.

TOPIC: React Hooks Rules Violation

Error: Invalid Hook Call

Description: Hooks must be called at the top level in the body of a function component or custom hook, and may not be called within function expressions.

Rule Violation: Hooks cannot be called inside nested functions, callbacks, or event handlers.

Example Violation:
```javascript
function MyComponent() {
  const handleClick = () => {
    useState(0); // Invalid: Called inside an event handler
  };

}

```javascript
function MyComponent() {
  const [count, setCount] = useState(0);
  const handleClick = () => {
    setCount(count + 1);
  };
  return <button onClick={handleClick}>Clicked {count} times</button>;
}
```
